headline: Does McCormick’s (MKC) Dividend and Spicy Candy Launch Reflect Evolving Brand and Capital Strategy?
summary: McCormick & Company announced that its Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.45 per share, payable on October 27, 2025, and also introduced Frank’s RedHot Spicy Gummy Bears in partnership with Huer Foods, tapping into the growing "swicy" trend in Canada. This combination of a dividend affirmation and an innovative product launch arrives just as the company prepares to report its third-quarter earnings, reflecting a blend of shareholder rewards and market-driven...

headline: Spices Giant McCormick Cuts Profit Outlook As Tariffs And Costs Bite
summary: McCormick & Company (NYSE:MKC) shares dropped in premarket trading Tuesday despite the company's third-quarter earnings surpassing analyst estimates. The decline was driven by investor concerns over rising costs and a trimmed outlook for earnings per share. The global manufacturer, marketer, and distributor of spices, herbs, extracts, and seasonings reported third-quarter adjusted earnings per share of 85 cents, beating the analyst consensus estimate of 81 cents. headline: AppLovin falls, Trilogy Metals soars on govt stake
summary: In early morning action, shares of AppLovin (APP) extended Monday's declines after a Bloomberg report said the company is facing an SEC investigation over its data collection practices. Meantime, Trilogy Metals (TMQ) shares are spiking after the White House announced the government is taking a 10% stake in the Canadian Mining company. On the earnings front, McCormick (MKC) reported better-than-expected results ahead of the open, but the company did cut its profit guidance. Constellation Brands (STZ) also on the move on quarterly results, which topped estimates. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

content.title: AppLovin falls, Trilogy Metals soars on govt stake
content.description:
In early morning action, shares of AppLovin (APP) extended Monday's declines after a Bloomberg report said the company is facing an SEC investigation over its data collection practices. Meantime, Trilogy Metals (TMQ) shares are spiking after the White House announced the government is taking a 10% stake in the Canadian Mining company. On the earnings front, McCormick (MKC) reported better-than-expected results ahead of the open, but the company did cut its profit guidance. Constellation Brands (STZ) also on the move on quarterly results, which topped estimates.

For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

On the earnings front, McCormick (MKC) reported better-than-expected results ahead of the open, but the company did cut its profit guidance. headline: McCormick shares edge higher as Q3 results top estimates
summary: Investing.com -- McCormick & Company saw its shares rise 1% premarket on Monday after the global flavor leader reported third-quarter results that exceeded analyst expectations, marking its fifth consecutive quarter of volume-led growth despite mounting cost pressures.

content.title: McCormick shares edge higher as Q3 results top estimates
content.summary: Investing.com -- McCormick & Company saw its shares rise 1% premarket on Monday after the global flavor leader reported third-quarter results that exceeded analyst expectations, marking its fifth consecutive quarter of volume-led growth despite mounting cost pressures.

headline: McCormick (NYSE:MKC) Exceeds Q3 Expectations
summary: Food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $1.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.85 per share was 4.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: McCormick (NYSE:MKC) Exceeds Q3 Expectations
content.summary: Food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $1.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.85 per share was 4.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: McCormick: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Hunt Valley, Maryland-based company said it had profit of 84 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were 85 cents per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

content.title: McCormick: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The Hunt Valley, Maryland-based company said it had profit of 84 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were 85 cents per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

headline: McCORMICK REPORTS THIRD QUARTER PERFORMANCE, REAFFIRMS STRONG SALES GROWTH, AND UPDATES 2025 PROFITABILITY OUTLOOK
summary: McCormick & Company, Incorporated (NYSE:MKC), a global leader in flavor, today reported financial results for the third quarter ended August 31, 2025 and reaffirmed sales growth outlook and updated operating income and earnings per share outlook for fiscal 2025.

content.title: McCORMICK REPORTS THIRD QUARTER PERFORMANCE, REAFFIRMS STRONG SALES GROWTH, AND UPDATES 2025 PROFITABILITY OUTLOOK
content.summary: McCormick & Company, Incorporated (NYSE:MKC), a global leader in flavor, today reported financial results for the third quarter ended August 31, 2025 and reaffirmed sales growth outlook and updated operating income and earnings per share outlook for fiscal 2025.
